data.text: @MarketCdn @NicolaJaneArt That's 89.9% of all deaths in that particular age group (fact). Conclusion: if the vaccines are predominantly given to people to prevent death, especially in old-age populations (80+), they have not done a good job based on these stats. It should not even be close!

@MarketCdn @NicolaJaneArt Understand:
In people 80+, 3046 individuals died as per the stats in the given time period (fact). Of these people, 237 were unvaccinated (fact - that's 7.78% of deaths in this age group). 2,738 individuals died while having had two doses or three doses (combined). That is fact..
@WagnerYeager @NicolaJaneArt @HeinonenHelena @klpeeks Not sure what you mean by your comparison unvaxxed vs unvaxxed. Tells me though how detailed your work is.

@WagnerYeager @klpeeks @NicolaJaneArt @HeinonenHelena How rare are vaccine adverse events. Data? Also the 95% risk reduction is a relative risk reduction, not an absolute risk reduction. The absolute effect is less than 1% for which you also assume the vaccine adverse event risk (no matter how high that might be).

@WagnerYeager @HeinonenHelena @klpeeks @NicolaJaneArt How does your new table relate to the data on the other one?
All we were looking at was the same data. No matter how you slice it, the data is the data in the other table.
@AndyPan03390600 @NicolaJaneArt @justagoose121 and you feel that it is right for the fully vaxed to die?  Really?  Gold help your brain love.

@WagnerYeager @NicolaJaneArt I am aware that this is a factor. What I am saying is these are not even close to a satisfactory effectiveness. We were told in 2021 that the vaccine prevented infection, hospit, and deaths at a nearly 100% efficacy. Huge claim. Reality shows it's extremely far from that.
